summary: Build a responsive React project version of the provided "Valentine Journey" interactive webpage (multi-page flow with animations like floating hearts + glitter burst, popups, audio, and GIF/images).
architectural_notes: Implement as a responsive React single-page app with component-based pages and state-driven navigation.
Support user-configurable media assets (e.g., GIF) via a configurable asset path or upload/selection, and reference it from React state/config rather than hardcoding.
Prefer stable, direct image URLs (e.g., media.tenor.com *.gif) over Tenor page URLs (tenor.com/view/...) to avoid hotlink/expiry issues; validate GIF URLs per screen in centralized asset config.
known_issues: Previous deployment/draft expired; site needs rebuild/redeploy to provide a working shareable link.
Several screens‚Äô Tenor GIFs fail to load (1st, 3rd, 4th, 6th, 7th, last); requires replacing with stable direct GIF URLs.

existing_features.title: Recreate the provided Valentine HTML/CSS/JS experience as a responsive React + TypeScript UI with Tailwind styling, preserving the same multi-screen flow: (1) ‚ÄúWill You Be My Valentine?‚Äù screen with Yes/No actions, (2) ‚ÄúChoose your Gift‚Äù screen, (3) Gift 1 question screen with four choices, (4) Gift 2 message screen, (5) Gift 3 message + two images screen, and (6) final success screen.

Implement the falling-hearts animation as a React-friendly effect (no direct DOM scripting outside React lifecycle), matching the original behavior: hearts spawn periodically at random horizontal positions, fall down the viewport with varying durations, and get cleaned up after they finish.

Add background music playback using a bundled static audio asset, with safe browser behavior: provide a visible play/pause control and attempt autoplay only where allowed. The music should loop when playing.

Create a cohesive Valentine-themed visual design using Tailwind: warm pink/rose palette, soft gradients, rounded buttons, and a playful typography pairing (including a safe fallback if Poppins is unavailable). Apply the theme consistently across all screens.

Add a simple asset pipeline for the referenced media (GIF + photos + audio): place assets under a frontend public assets folder and update the React UI to reference those paths. Provide sensible placeholders if user photos are not available.
Add a user-facing way to replace the default couple GIF on the ‚ÄúWill You Be My Valentine?‚Äù screen with a user-chosen GIF, without requiring code changes.

Add a new first screen (Welcome) before the existing ‚ÄúWill You Be My Valentine?‚Äù screen, matching the user‚Äôs original HTML flow: show a welcome title/message, display a ‚ÄúRose GIF‚Äù image, and provide a single ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù button that navigates to the existing Valentine question screen.

Use the user-provided Tenor GIF URLs in the React app: set the default GIF on the ‚ÄúWill You Be My Valentine?‚Äù screen to https://media.tenor.com/wGUEcMJvn1gAAAAd/bubu-dudu-hug.gif, and add/display the Gift 2 Kiss GIF (https://media.tenor.com/tz2d6kItD0gAAAAd/bubu-dudu-kisses.gif) on the Gift 2 message screen similarly to the original HTML.
Update the ValentineFlow navigation model to include the new Welcome screen while preserving all existing screens, animations (falling hearts), and background music behavior.
Remove the existing ‚ÄúJust Us‚Äù content/section from the Valentine flow UI (currently the subtitle text shown on the Gift 3 images screen) so it no longer renders anywhere in the app.

Convert the current Gift 1 screen from a single-question screen into an MCQ quiz consisting of these 5 questions (one-at-a-time or all-at-once is acceptable), each with four options A‚ÄìD, and with the specified correct answer per question:

Q1: ‚ÄúDo you want me in your life forever ‚ôæÔ∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù
A) ‚ÄúYes‚Äù
B) ‚ÄúNo‚Äù
C) ‚ÄúNever‚Äù
D) ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù  (Correct: D)

Q2: ‚ÄúWhen did our relationship start? üòÅ‚Äù
A) ‚Äú13 December 2020‚Äù
B) ‚Äú15 November 2021‚Äù
C) ‚Äú15 November 2020‚Äù (Correct: C)
D) ‚Äú20 November 2021‚Äù

Q3: ‚ÄúAre you happy with me?‚Äù
A) ‚ÄúNooo‚Äù
B) ‚ÄúYes‚Äù
C) ‚ÄúNot sure‚Äù
D) ‚ÄúYes, of course‚Äù (Correct: D)

Q4: ‚ÄúHow much do you love me?‚Äù
A) ‚Äú10000%‚Äù
B) ‚ÄúUnlimited ‚ú®‚Äù (Correct: B)
C) ‚Äú0%‚Äù
D) ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt love you‚Äù

Q5: ‚ÄúWhen did we have our first kiss? üíã‚Äù
A) ‚Äú16 November 2020‚Äù
B) ‚Äú18 November 2020‚Äù (Correct: B)
C) ‚Äú16 December 2021‚Äù
D) ‚Äú19 November 2021‚Äù

All user-facing text for this quiz must be in English.

Implement quiz answer feedback behavior on the Gift 1 MCQ quiz: when the user selects a wrong option, show a clearly visible red wrong indicator (e.g., red X/badge and/or red-highlighted option) and keep the user on the same question; when the user selects the correct option, show a popup message that says exactly: ‚ÄúWow, you are intelligent.‚Äù and then advance to the next question (or, if it was the final question, navigate to the existing Success screen).

Refactor the Valentine text constants to support the new Gift 1 quiz content and feedback messages, centralizing the new quiz strings in the existing strings module and removing/retiring the old Gift 1 single-question option strings that are no longer used.

Add persistent "Back" and "Next" navigation controls below the main content on every Valentine flow screen (Welcome, Will You Be My Valentine, Choose Your Gift, Gift 1 Quiz, Gift 2 Message, Gift 3 Images, Success) so users can move sequentially through the screens.

Display a GIF on every Valentine flow screen, including screens that currently do not show a GIF (Choose Your Gift, Gift 1 Quiz, Gift 3 Images, Success), using the existing asset pipeline and safe fallback behavior if a GIF fails to load.
Update the centralized strings module to include any new English user-facing text introduced by the Back/Next controls and any new GIF fallback labels used on newly updated screens.

Update the Valentine flow to match the provided HTML page sequence by adding a dedicated ‚ÄúCongratulations‚Äù screen between the Valentine question screen and the Gifts screen, with the exact headings ‚Äúüéâ Congratulations My Love ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù and ‚ÄúYou won my heart üòò‚Äù, an ‚ÄúOpen Gifts üéÅ‚Äù primary button that navigates to the Gifts screen, and Back/Next controls that follow the linear flow.

Implement the final surprise interaction from the provided HTML by adding a new final ‚ÄúFinal Surprise Baby ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®‚Äù screen that displays a GIF, shows the prompt ‚ÄúClick the Surprise Box üéÅüëá‚Äù, renders the clickable surprise box image (https://cdn-icons-png.flaticon.com/512/4208/4208394.png), and on click reveals the pop-up message with a pop-out animation and triggers a short glitter/sparkle burst effect.

Update the Valentine flow navigation model and types to include the new screens and to match the HTML ordering: Welcome ‚Üí Valentine Question ‚Üí Congratulations ‚Üí Gift 1 Quiz ‚Üí Gift 2 Message ‚Üí Gift 3 ‚Üí Final Surprise. Ensure the existing Back/Next controls continue to work across all screens in this updated order.

Update the centralized asset configuration so the app uses the exact GIF URLs from the user-provided HTML for the corresponding screens: Welcome GIF https://media.tenor.com/tZkz0CuxR2AAAAAM/bubu-dudu-love.gif; Valentine question GIF https://media.tenor.com/eT2ymlk4C9oAAAAM/bubu-dudu.gif; Congratulations GIF https://media.tenor.com/jEyyU6zQymMAAAAM/bubu-dudu-hug.gif; Gift 1 GIF https://media.tenor.com/zeGZqSEuxbIAAAAM/bubu-dudu-love.gif; Gift 2 GIF https://media.tenor.com/8D4tHULICL0AAAAM/bubu-dudu-kiss.gif; Gift 3 GIF https://media.tenor.com/U4E7B7C9ZwQAAAAM/dudu-and-bubu.gif; Final Surprise GIF https://media.tenor.com/Z_M1hU8Z2n4AAAAM/bubu-dudu.gif.

Change the behavior of the Valentine question screen‚Äôs ‚ÄúNo‚Äù action to match the provided HTML: each press of ‚ÄúNo‚Äù should increase the visual size (e.g., font size / scale) of the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button progressively, instead of showing an alert.

Ensure all user-facing quiz strings are written in English with consistent capitalization and phrasing, aligning the Gift 1 quiz content with the provided HTML‚Äôs five questions while keeping the existing correct-answer feedback message exactly ‚ÄúWow, you are intelligent.‚Äù.

Remove the photo/images section from the Valentine flow UI so that no user photos are displayed anywhere in the app, specifically removing the two memory images currently rendered on the Gift 3 screen.

Clean up unused photo asset references after removing the photo section: ensure the frontend codebase no longer imports or references the removed photo assets from the centralized asset configuration.

Update ONLY the GIF image corresponding to the selected element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/img[1]) so it uses this exact URL as its src: https://media.tenor.com/AZ12YafzVwwAAAAi/bubu-dudu-prince-bubu-dudu-princess.gif. In the current code, this should be achieved by updating the GIF source used by the screen/component that renders that selected (currently the Gift 3 GIF sourced from ASSETS.gift3Gif used in Gift3ImagesScreen).

Update ONLY the GIF image corresponding to the selected element (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/img[1]) so it uses this exact URL as its src: https://media.tenor.com/oWTGv7XpHY4AAAAi/sseeyall-bubu-dudu.gif. In the current code, achieve this by updating the GIF source used by the screen/component that renders that selected (Gift3ImagesScreen uses src={ASSETS.gift3Gif}), so ASSETS.gift3Gif points to the new URL.

Update the GIF sources for the screens the user reported as not loading (1st, 3rd, 4th, 6th, 7th, and last screens in the current FLOW_ORDER) by replacing the configured GIF URLs with the exact user-provided URLs, and ensure each affected screen renders its updated GIF.

new_feature_requests.summary: Convert the provided Valentine HTML/CSS/JS page into a responsive React project (components, navigation between pages, falling hearts animation, audio, and assets).
Allow replacing the default bear-couple GIF with a user-chosen GIF (provide a configurable asset path or upload/selection mechanism and update UI to use it).
Add the requested Bubu Dudu Rose GIF to the first (welcome) page in addition to the existing Hug (Page 2) and Kiss (Page 5) GIFs.
Rebuild and redeploy the Valentine website to provide a clean, shareable public URL (shared-link website).

Replace the existing "Just Us" section with an MCQ questions section (likely on Gift 1 screen): present provided questions/options, track correct answers, show a visible red indicator on wrong choice, and show a "woww you are intelligent" popup on correct choice.
Add Back/Next navigation controls on each page (below the content) to allow moving through the multi-page flow sequentially.
Add/display a GIF on each page/screen of the Valentine flow (ensure every page includes an appropriate GIF element).
Implement the final surprise interaction from the provided HTML: clickable surprise box that reveals a pop-up message with a pop-out animation and triggers a short glitter/sparkle burst effect.
Remove the photo/images section from the Valentine flow UI (do not show the photo section anywhere, including the Gift 3 images screen if present).
Update the app‚Äôs relevant default GIF to use https://media.tenor.com/AZ12YafzVwwAAAAi/bubu-dudu-prince-bubu-dudu-princess.gif (replacing the currently configured GIF URL).

Update the app‚Äôs relevant GIF asset to use the newly provided Tenor URL: https://media.tenor.com/oWTGv7XpHY4AAAAi/sseeyall-bubu-dudu.gif (replace the currently configured GIF on the intended screen).

Fix GIFs not loading on multiple screens by updating the GIF sources for the 1st, 3rd, 4th, 6th, 7th, and last screens to the user-provided Tenor URLs (replace the non-loading GIFs with the specified links).

projectName: Convert Valentine HTML page into a responsive React app
